required_parameters.name: identity_provider
required_parameters.description: The desired social network your user to authenticate with. If no identity_provider parameter is provided, it will default to email and password authentication. You can also set identity_provider to gateway to use our UI to let the user choose who to sign in with.

optional_parameters.name: redirect_uri
optional_parameters.description: After authentication, the user will be redirected to this url. The url must be within one of your approved domains in your account settings. If omitted we will use your account default callback.

optional_parameters.name: state
optional_parameters.description: You can include a state parameter to help prevent cross-site request forgery. When your user is redirected back to your site after authenticating, the state parameter will be included.

api_list.api_description: This resource list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.
This resource returns a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable:  last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.
Retrieves the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.
This resource lists all the existing data sources of a user.

This resource obtains an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source:  number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity
This resource returns the values of the specified variable.  Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

api_list.api_description:
enter the number you want to validate.
Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/_h5ybzp9UNU).

required_parameters.name: phone
required_parameters.description:
The whatsapp number must be written as: number (including countrycode); do **NOT** include any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number. Otherwise, the request will not be processed.
Examples: of correct numbers are: 34123456789 (for spain) or 491234567890 (for Germany).
TIPS:
    Do NOT include '+' before your countrycode,
    Do NOT include a '-', or any other character or space (anything which is not a number) as part of your phone number.
    If you do not know which is your country code check this: https://countrycode.org/

api_list.api_description: Requests to this endpoint will return `true` if the number is a **Whatsapp for Business** account, or `false` if it's not.

required_parameters.name: phone
required_parameters.description:
The whatsapp number must be written as: `countrycode` and `number`; do NOT include any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number.
Examples: of correct numbers are: `34123456789` (for spain) or `491234567890` (for Germany).
Country codes can be checked here: https://countrycode.org/

From this endpoint is to list all registered qr codes, related to their api key.

From this endpoint you can generate a single api key.

It will be used to link all the qr code created, and allow any changes.

Important: Keep in mind that once generated, it is necessary that you store this key well, since it is not possible to recover it, and without it, you do not have access to change any of your QR Codes.

required_parameters.name: modules
required_parameters.default: A comma-delimited list of one or more insights to request.

required_parameters.default: An ID that uniquely identifies a video. The Video object's videoId field contains the ID that you set this parameter to.

api_list.api_description: Get videos relevant for a given query.

optional_parameters.name: safeSearch
optional_parameters.description: A filter used to filter results for adult content.

optional_parameters.name: mkt
optional_parameters.description:
The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

Full list of supported markets:
es-AR, en-AU, de-AT, nl-BE, fr-BE, pt-BR, en-CA, fr-CA, es-CL, da-DK, fi-FI, fr-FR, de-DE, zh-HK, en-IN, en-ID, en-IE, it-IT, ja-JP, ko-KR, en-MY, es-MX, nl-NL, en-NZ, no-NO, zh-CN, pl-PL, pt-PT, en-PH, ru-RU, ar-SA, en-ZA, es-ES, sv-SE, fr-CH, de-CH, zh-TW, tr-TR, en-GB, en-US, es-US

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The number of video results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of video results to skip before returning results.

(Default: Random scale if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: moveLeft
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 100 ( Default: 0 )

optional_parameters.name: angle
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 360 (Default: Random angle if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: strokeJoin
optional_parameters.description:
round or square 
(Default: round)
Valid only for patterns with Stroke Join as specified at https://pattern.monster/api

optional_parameters.name: moveTop
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 100 ( Default: 0 )

optional_parameters.name: colors
optional_parameters.description:
2 to Max Colors of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
Format: Color1|Color2|Color3|Color4|Color5
At least, two colors are required if specified
(Default: Random colors if not specified)
Accepted color values: 
CSS colors ( eg. aqua, red )
RGB or RGBA colors ( eg. rgb(59,130,246), rgba(234,179,8,0.7) )
HSL or HSLA colors ( eg. hsl(300, 76%, 72%), hsla(147,50%,47%,0.5) )
HEX colors without the hash symbol ( eg. E11D48, 2563eb )

optional_parameters.name: spacing
optional_parameters.description:
Horizontal Spacing | Vertical Spacing
(Default: 0|0)
Max Spacing of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
Valid only for patterns with Max Spacing other than 0|0

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description:
0.5 to Max Stroke of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random stroke if not specified)
Valid only for patterns with Mode as Stroke

query: Hey, Pattern Monster! Could you create an SVG pattern with the name 'waves-1'? I want the pattern to have a scale of 1.5, an angle of 120, and stroke join set to square. Also, please move it 20% to the left and 10% down. Thanks a lot!

relevant APIs: Check page or website loading speed

api_list.api_description: This API will return the Campaign details including variables used in the overall Campaign.

api_list.api_description: Poll this API until it returns that the image is available.  If available, you can download through endpoint 1.  Rendering an image depends largely on how fast a particular web page is loaded (and if it contains Flash).  Average waiting time is around 20 - 60 seconds

required_parameters.name: size
required_parameters.description: t = Tiny, 90 x 68 pixels;  s= Small, 120 x 90 pixels;  m = Medium, 200 x 150 pixels; l = Large, 400 x 300 pixels;  x = Extra large, 480 x 360 pixels

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to generate the thumbnail from

api_list.api_description: Issues a reset API call if refresh is set to 1. Else it will download if the image is ready (see endpoint 2.)

required_parameters.name: size
required_parameters.description: t = Tiny, 90 x 68 pixels;  s= Small, 120 x 90 pixels;  m = Medium, 200 x 150 pixels; l = Large, 400 x 300 pixels;  x = Extra large, 480 x 360 pixels

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to generate the thumbnail from

optional_parameters.name: refresh
optional_parameters.description: This parameter forces the currently generate d thumbnail to be regenerated.  It is optional and will be ignored unless it contains the value 1
